metrics.description: Total number of ICU encounters recorded in the governed ICU data extract. Volume measure for intensive care utilization.
Ratio of observed to expected length of stay, adjusted for case mix. Values >1.0 indicate longer stays than expected; <1.0 indicates shorter.
Risk-adjusted expected length of stay in days, based on case mix and severity. Used as the benchmark for LOS Index calculation.
Average observed length of stay in days across all discharges in the cohort. Raw measure of hospitalization duration.
Variance of inpatient length of stay measured in days for the entity cohort. Represents the spread of LOS around the mean.
Average number of days patients spend in the ICU, sourced from the governed ICU extract. Reflects ICU length of stay intensity.
metrics.null_fill_rationale: Null indicates zero ICU encounters for this entity (pctIcuEncountersIcuFile = 0). Semantically, if no patients went to the ICU, mean ICU days is 0.

metrics.description: Percentage of patients who return to the ICU during the same hospitalization. Indicator of care quality and patient stability after ICU discharge.
Percentage of total encounters that include an ICU stay, per the governed ICU extract. Reflects case mix intensity and acuity distribution.

edge_types.description: Roll-up relationship indicating this signal is computed by aggregating multiple source signals. The reverse of segmentation.
Conflict relationship where signals present opposing or inconsistent information. Flags potential data quality issues or anomalies.
Breakdown relationship showing the constituent factors of a composite metric. Enables variance analysis and contribution tracking.
Computational relationship where one signal is mathematically derived from another. Indicates formula-based dependency.
Hierarchical drill-down from a parent aggregation to child detail entities. Enables navigation from high-level metrics to underlying components.
Analytical relationship where one signal provides context or explanation for another. The source signal helps interpret the target signal.

Exploratory navigation from an outcome signal to a potential driver dimension. Suggests the source outcome may be influenced by the target dimension but does not assert causation. Used for hypothesis generation and root cause analysis.
General association between two signals that share context or correlation. Does not imply causation or hierarchy.
Segmentation from a whole to its constituent parts without hierarchy. Shows how a metric decomposes into discrete segments.
Evidence relationship where one signal reinforces or confirms another. Indicates corroborating information.
Temporal navigation from an aggregate summary to a time-series breakdown. Enables viewing how a metric changes over time periods.

tag_types.description: Metrics and narratives focused on length-of-stay performance.
Artifacts that evaluate patient throughput and flow dynamics.
Insights emphasizing longitudinal movement or deltas over time.

comparison_modes.description: Benchmarks entity metrics against a governance-defined benchmark trajectory rather than peer trends.
comparison_modes.baseline_description: Governance-defined benchmark baseline for the metric.
comparison_modes.authoring_hint: Use when a metric_method_set compares entity performance to a defined benchmark target instead of peers.

comparison_modes.description: Benchmarks metrics against the entity's own historical performance window.
comparison_modes.baseline_description: Entity historical trend across the selected time periods
comparison_modes.authoring_hint: Reference this mode when a metric_method_set comparison uses the entity's history as the baseline.

comparison_modes.description: Compares entity metrics against Vizient-matched peer cohort distributions.
comparison_modes.baseline_description: Vizient peer cohort for the facility
comparison_modes.authoring_hint: Reference this mode when a metric_method_set comparison benchmarks the entity versus peers.

comparison_modes.display_name: Vizient Quality & Accountability Study AMC Cohort Distribution
comparison_modes.description: Benchmarks each entity against the Vizient Quality & Accountability Study 2025 academic medical center cohort for aggregated periods.
comparison_modes.baseline_description: Vizient QA Study 2025 academic medical center peer distribution for the aggregated time period
comparison_modes.authoring_hint: Use when a metric_method_set baselines entity performance against the Vizient QA AMC 2025 cohort distribution.
